Open Window->Preferences, and under Java, Installed JREs, see what's listed there
What do you see in the Name and Location columns there?
Open the Preferences window (Window->Preferences on the menu bar)
You get a window with a list of items on the left side...  click the arrow next to "Java", then click on "Installed JREs"
I mean the Eclipse menu, not the GNOME Applications menu
Did you install any packages with "sun-java" in their name?
and how did you install that?
Installing Java 6 would not give you a /usr/lib/jre/java-1.5.0 -- that'd give you /usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun-1.6.0.10 (assuming 8.10)
so that /usr/lib/jvm/java-1.5.0 that Eclipse is running under must've come from something else
You have Sun Java 6 *and* GCJ's clone of Java 1.5
and the 1.5 one seems to be what Eclipse was running under
